intro: Alseodaphne archboldiana, commonly known as the Archbold's alseodaphne, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the island of Guam in the Western Pacific and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a small tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its bark is smooth and grayish-brown, and it produces small, dark berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
